channel.title: Bad lag problems?
channel.description:
okay when people connect to the server, they stay on for a few minutes, then just lag out idk what the problem is it was working fine last night heres a pic of waht it does it repeats this, ive restarted my computer, server, and everything anybody help please o.O
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/fnr5v7.jpg[/img]

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

[quote=“si force, post:11, topic:276439”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=365073.msg2769556#msg2769556 date=1241037045]

Clean all of the shit out of your source files, by that I mean clean out Every method you don’t use, remove global objects, Dialogue, commands and all of that.

Also it could be your computer spec’s, if you have 512MB or under, I wouldn’t recommend hosting a server.

Technically, a user can host a server with less than 128MB if the source is stable.
[/quote]

I’m aware of this, I’ve seen people host a source with 32MB of RAM, with no server-sided LAG,
their source was extremely stable though, I was talking about his source as it isn’t stable.[/quote] well ive used this for months, with no lag idk it just started this morning

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:5, topic:276439”][quote author=si force link=topic=365073.msg2769552#msg2769552 date=1241036910]
Clean all of the shit out of your source files, by that I mean clean out Every method you don’t use, remove global objects, Dialogue, commands and all of that.

Also it could be your computer spec’s, if you have 512MB or under, I wouldn’t recommend hosting a server.
[/quote]
Technically, a user can host a server with less than 128MB if the source is stable.[/quote]

I’m aware of this, I’ve seen people host a source with 32MB of RAM, with no server-sided LAG,
their source was extremely stable though, I was talking about his source as it isn’t stable.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

[quote=“koopa king, post:7, topic:276439”]If there has also been a lot of people on your server, look through your character files and logs and delete any of your non-loyal players. I did this on my old server, and I removed about 1.2MB of old character files of people that logged in and out. =P[/quote] yes i jsut removed about 3.5k files recently back up to 500 but meh [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 29, 2009, 02:35:48 pm[/size][hr]i ran an anti lag it stope dthem from lagging out but still i never had to use this id like to fix this problem

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @Chris_GD Chris GD
item.description:
@Chris_GD wrote:

Try cleaning your methods as already said, if that don’t work, have you added or tried coding something new in before this started happening, if so remove what you coded in and then try it. If that don’t work then just say it on a post and I’ll see any other ideas i might have.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

i dont use fight pits, or fight caves nothing in tzhaar is used how would i go removeing the fight cave? just remove the waves or something

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

If there has also been a lot of people on your server, look through your character files and logs and delete any of your non-loyal players. I did this on my old server, and I removed about 1.2MB of old character files of people that logged in and out. =P

Read full topic

item.title: Bad lag problems?
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

[quote=“si force, post:3, topic:276439”]Clean all of the shit out of your source files, by that I mean clean out Every method you don’t use, remove global objects, Dialogue, commands and all of that.

Also it could be your computer spec’s, if you have 512MB or under, I wouldn’t recommend hosting a server.[/quote]ive been hosting for 2-3 months perfect ive never had this problem[quote=“jc22493, post:5, topic:276439”][quote author=si force link=topic=365073.msg2769552#msg2769552 date=1241036910]
Clean all of the shit out of your source files, by that I mean clean out Every method you don’t use, remove global objects, Dialogue, commands and all of that.

Also it could be your computer spec’s, if you have 512MB or under, I wouldn’t recommend hosting a server.
[/quote]
Technically, a user can host a server with less than 128MB if the source is stable.[/quote], and ive had this source for awhile no prolem, and ill try that cleaning out my files
